basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2012 by Dusty Davidson, Rick Knudtson, and Tony Noecker in Omaha, Nebraska. Acquired by WP Engine in 2019 for approximately $200M. Continues to operate as a division of WP Engine with same brand and leadership. Focused on designers and creative agencies. Runs on Google Cloud Platform. Offices in Omaha and Sydney.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: 60-day money-back guarantee for Tiny, Startup, and non-custom Freelance plans

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: 20GB included on Tiny plan; $1-2 per 1,000 extra visitors; may be charged for consistent overages
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Violation of ToS; non-payment; excessive resource usage
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Bandwidth/storage overage; malicious code; prohibited content
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Lower starting price than parent WP Engine ($15 vs $25); Free demo sites feature; Free malware cleanup; Local development tool included (Local by Flywheel); No phone support; Bulk pricing for 30+ sites

contentRestrictions.contentNotes: WordPress-only hosting with focus on designers/agencies

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: $50-$500 per sale depending on plan; 90-day cookie

editorial.knownIssues: Owned by WP Engine since 2019; No phone support; No Redis caching; Storage limited on entry plan (5GB); No dedicated IPs; No PCI compliance unlike parent WP Engine; Fewer features than Kinsta at similar price point
editorial.bestFor: Designers and creative agencies; WordPress freelancers; Users wanting free Local development tool; Those who prefer Flywheel's interface over WP Engine; Budget managed WordPress users ($15/mo entry); Sites needing free demo sites feature
editorial.avoidIf: Need phone support; Need PCI compliance (use WP Engine instead); Need Redis caching; Large storage requirements; Prefer independent company (owned by WP Engine)
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Cheaper than parent WP Engine ($15 vs $25 entry); Free Local development tool (excellent); Designer-focused features; G2 4.5 good; Trustpilot 4.4 solid; White-label available for agencies; Fastly CDN included; Google Cloud infrastructure; Less feature-rich than Kinsta

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Designer-focused managed WordPress with free Local development tool and lower price than parent WP Engine
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Designer or creative agency wanting managed WordPress with great local development tools at lower cost than WP Engine

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Flywheel is excellent for designers and agencies wanting managed WordPress at a lower price than WP Engine ($15/mo vs $25/mo). The free Local development tool is highly praised. G2 4.5 and Trustpilot 4.4 ratings are solid.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Flywheel was acquired by WP Engine in 2019 for approximately $200M. It continues to operate as a separate brand with the same leadership team, originally founded in Omaha, Nebraska in 2012.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Flywheel Tiny plan starts at $15/month for 1 site. Higher plans from $30/month. Bulk pricing available for 30+ sites. No renewal price increases.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Yes, Flywheel has a designer-friendly dashboard and the free Local development tool makes it easy to build sites locally before deploying.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No, Flywheel does not include email hosting. Third-party email services are recommended.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, Flywheel is WordPress-only managed hosting with staging, automatic updates, and nightly backups included.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Flywheel guarantees 99.9% uptime backed by Google Cloud Platform infrastructure.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with a 30-day money-back guarantee. Monthly billing available with no long-term contracts.
